security_audit.summary: Legitimate CLI tool for web search and code context retrieval via Exa's MCP API. Network calls to documented endpoint, minimal filesystem access for caching, and standard API key authentication. No malicious patterns detected.

content.user_title: Search the web and code context with Exa
content.value_statement: Need to find real-time information or code examples for your coding tasks. This skill connects to Exa's search API to retrieve web content and programming context directly from your CLI.
actual_capabilities: Search the web for real-time information and content
Retrieve code context and programming examples
Filter searches by type (auto, fast, deep)
Control result count and context length
Cache results locally for faster repeated queries
Output results as plain text or JSON
limitations: Requires an Exa API key (EXA_API_KEY or EXA_MCP_TOKEN environment variable)
Searches are limited to Exa's indexed content and web crawl data
Live web crawling requires specific API access and may have rate limits
No built-in authentication for protecting search results

use_cases.title: Find code examples
use_cases.description: Look up how to use specific libraries or APIs with real-world code examples

prompt_templates.title: Basic Web Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search the web for information about [TOPIC] using exa-cli web-search-exa

prompt_templates.title: Code Pattern Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Find code examples for [PATTERN] using exa-cli get-code-context-exa with 500 tokens

prompt_templates.title: API Documentation Search
prompt_templates.prompt: Search for [API_NAME] documentation and usage examples using exa-cli

prompt_templates.title: Deep Technical Research
prompt_templates.prompt: Conduct deep research on [TECHNOLOGY] focusing on best practices and common patterns using exa-cli with type=deep

output_examples.input: Search for how to use Python async await patterns
output: âœ“ Found 5 relevant results from Exa search
Snippet: Async/await syntax allows you to write concurrent code...
Snippet: asyncio is a library to write concurrent code using async/await...

best_practices: Set the EXA_API_KEY environment variable before running searches
Use JSON output (--json) for programmatic processing of results
Enable caching (default) to reduce API calls for repeated queries
anti_patterns: Sharing your API key in public repositories or chat messages
Running searches without checking result relevance first
Ignoring rate limits or terms of service for Exa API

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code CLI tools.

faq.question: How many search results can I get?
faq.answer: Default is automatic. You can set --num-results to control the count.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Use --json flag to get machine-readable output for scripting.

faq.question: Is my search data stored?
faq.answer: Results are cached locally for 1 hour. Configure with --cache-ttl or disable with --no-cache.

faq.question: Why are my searches failing?
faq.answer: Check that EXA_API_KEY is set. Verify network connectivity to https://mcp.exa.ai/mcp.

faq.question: How is this different from regular search?
faq.answer: Exa provides AI-enhanced search with code-specific context and content extraction beyond simple links.
